results.title: Kicking on
results.brief_description: Using the great Australian sporting tradition of Aussie rules as a catalyst to explore gay male sexuality, this sweet, funny take on mateship and fair play on and off the field gives a whole new meaning to the term ‘holding the man’. Kicking on ultimately highlights the intimate spaces men create for each other that allow for physical contact and a dogmatic loyalty that in any other name would be called love.

results.title: Kick to kick [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Fiona Tuomy and Tony McNamara
results.brief_description: An hilarious short Australian film in which Derek and Kay teach their son Hec “how to use his body” and the finer points of Australian Rules football in a backyard game of Kick-to-Kick. A must-see for football supporters of all ages. Starring Richard Healy, Caz Lederman and Matt Long.

results.title: Ki or breathing
results.creator_credit: Committee For The Year 2001, Teruji Dhibata, Arata Isozaki and Toshio Matsumoto
results.brief_description: An experimental film that attempts to create through the ‘breathing’ of visuals and music, the rhythm of Ki, the Japanese ideogram that symbolises the energy permeating the whole universe.

results.title: Khmer! Khmer!: Cambodia in conflict (D)
results.creator_credit: Experimental Film and Television Fund, ABC and James G. Gerrand
results.brief_description: Portrays the life, culture, history and politics of the Cambodians. Focuses on Norodom Sihanouk’s abdication from the throne and becoming the first Democratic Leader of Cambodia, thus destroying the old feudal system and through to social and political destruction during the Vietnam War. Narrated by Richard Oxenburgh. WARNING: Contains graphic scenes of war related deaths.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Experimental Film and Television Fund, ABC and James G. Gerrand

results.title: Khalid’s surprise
results.brief_description: Machinima is animating using the 3D real-time virtual worlds of computer games as opposed to the complex, non real-time 3D animation software used by professionals. The game engine used to create this compelling short homage to a highly popular film is Battlefield 2, Battlefield 2: Modern Combat features a propaganda-fuelled single player campaign where gamers play both sides of a conflict in one of the most treacherous regions in the world - Kazakhstan

results.title: Khajuraho
results.creator_credit: Films Division, Government of India, Jehangir Bhownagary and Mohan Wadhwani
results.brief_description: The renaissance in Hindu culture of a thousand years ago as seen in the abandoned temples near the village of Khajuraho. Twenty of the original 85 temples remain and in their elaborate sculptures are reflected the religious concepts and the immense artistic vitality of the period.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Films Division, Government of India, Jehangir Bhownagary and Mohan Wadhwani
